radialcolordialog

Class AlphaSlider

  • java.lang.Object
    • radialcolordialog.AlphaSlider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InteractiveSlider

    public class AlphaSlider
extends java.lang.Object
implements InteractiveSlider
    The AlphaSlider is a linear slider for the Alpha Channel. This is implemented as a linear slider to use built-in mechanisms to display the alpha cleanly.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      AlphaSlider(java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D bounds, java.awt.Color color, AlphaSliderListener listener)
      Build the slider from the bounds and default color.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AlphaSlider

        public AlphaSlider(java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D bounds,
                   java.awt.Color color,
                   AlphaSliderListener listener)
        Build the slider from the bounds and default color. The bounds are described in world space coordinates.
        Parameters:
        bounds - The bounds of the slider.
        color - The default color for the slider.
        listener - The listener for changes.

    • Method Detail

        public int getValue()
        Get the Value of the slider (0-255)
        Returns:

        Set the alpha value of the slider.
        Parameters:
        value - The value of the alpha channel..

      • setColor

        public final void setColor(java.awt.Color color)
        Set the display color. This is amended with the current alpha.
        Parameters:
        color - The color to use for display.

        public boolean containsPoint(java.awt.geom.Point2D point)
        Called by the display panel to do a hit test.
        Specified by:
        containsPoint in interface InteractiveSlider
        Parameters:
        point - The point in world coordinates.
        Returns:
